author: Scott Adam Gordon
title: Flir introduces new thermal imaging cameras for Android
text:
Thermal imaging tech manufacturer Flir has revealed its new camera attachments for Android. The third-generation Flir One cameras connect to smartphones via a USB Type-C port to take thermal photos and videos, or provide a real-time look at the temperature range of an object or scene.
The latest Flir One features an all-new image processor, a higher resolution camera and is less expensive than its predecessor from 2015, launching for $199 compared to the $250. In addition, the new model has an adjustable dongle which allows it to be used when the smartphone is housed in a case (this previously required use of an adapter).
See also: Samsung dual-camera tech patent could improve capture of moving images 18 hours ago Meanwhile, the company has also introduced the Flir One Pro, an even more durable version with a more powerful thermal sensor. As the name suggests, the Pro version is targeted at professionals with more specific functions like “multiple spot temperature meters” and “one-touch reporting capabilities”
The Flir One Pro will go on sale for $399 and both devices will be available in the first half of 2017.
